definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: He could not get a hare again; instead he was laughed at by the people of Song.
sentences.chinese: 兔子他再也得不到，他自己反倒被宋國人嘲笑了。

sentences.english: The Stillwater factory is now being closed instead.
sentences.chinese: 現在反倒是Stillwater的工廠被關閉了。

sentences.english: With poetic justice, the crisis recoiled against Paris and destroyed the franc.
sentences.chinese: 老天有眼，這場危機反倒使巴黎和法郎受害頗深。

sentences.english: ELEPHANTS are not fazed by dynamite explosions, but change their behaviour significantly to avoid humans.
sentences.chinese: 大象沒有被甘油炸彈嚇到，反倒是對人的活動很敏感。

sentences.english: In this case, the unions helped encourage them.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，工會反倒是火山加油，激化矛盾。

sentences.english: To me it wasn't an insult; I rather like the nickname Lucy.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得這個外號是一種侮辱，反倒很喜歡它。

sentences.english: But it turns out that time shifting is ourmost valued product.
sentences.chinese: 不過現在看來，非實時性產品反倒成爲我們最珍視的。

sentences.english: Taking over this hand, so that new, unfortunately.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的大操大辦反倒讓新人不幸。

sentences.english: Dabashi's silence brings to the foreground the meaning of naming.
sentences.chinese: 這種沉默反倒將名字的意義問題推向了前臺。

sentences.english: Now it's a point of pride in a weird way.
sentences.chinese: 現在行爲怪異反倒讓人有種莫名其妙的自豪感。

sentences.english: The scheme rebounded on her in a way she had not expected.
sentences.chinese: 她未曾想到這計謀反倒使她自食其果。

sentences.english: She handed out water to the protesting workers but got fierce stares.
sentences.chinese: 她把水分發給抗議的工人們，反倒遭到怒目相對。

sentences.english: It means I can have tea, instead.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着我反倒可以喝茶了。

sentences.english: When Xiao Wu was praised, he was embarrassed, much to our surprise.
sentences.chinese: 小吳受了表揚反倒不好意思起來了。

sentences.english: Then he looked for a crop of good grapes, but it yielded only bad fruit.
sentences.chinese: 指望結好葡萄，反倒結了野葡萄。

sentences.english: In contrast, the Lido looks much rather calm.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，麗都商圈反倒平靜得多。

definition: contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to appear to be/to seem as if
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
the slightest amount or degree/a bit
